title: 110 Goodbye Messages for Colleagues, Bosses, Friends & More

steps.title: Celebrate the retirement of a beloved coworker.
steps.content: Celebrate the retirement of a beloved coworker. Reaching retirement is a huge milestone, and it deserves to be celebrated. When writing a retirement message , thank the retiree for everything they’ve done for the company, list the qualities you admire about them, and wish them the best for their future. Here are some examples: [1] X Research source “Congratulations on your well-deserved retirement! Your hard work and dedication have inspired us all. Now it’s time to relax!” “You've worked tirelessly throughout your career, and now it's time to embrace the rewards of retirement. May this next chapter of your life be the best yet!” “Congratulations on reaching retirement. Thank you for everything you’ve done throughout your career.” “Today, you begin an endless holiday. Wishing you a retirement filled with joy and love.” “Congratulations on reaching this significant milestone in your life! You've left a huge impact on our team, and you will be greatly missed.” “Congratulations on your retirement! We’ll miss you dearly.” “Your retirement is a testament to your remarkable achievements and the mark you've left on our team. Congratulations and farewell!” “We’ll certainly miss seeing you in the office, but we’re so excited for you and your future. Enjoy your retirement.” “Retirement is the perfect time to pursue your passions and explore new horizons. Wishing you endless opportunities for personal growth and happiness.” “Your retirement is a celebration of your remarkable career and the countless lives you've touched. May this next chapter bring you peace and fulfillment.”

steps.title: Wish a coworker luck for their future career.
steps.content: Wish a coworker luck for their future career. If a coworker is leaving for new career opportunities, let them know how much you’ll miss them. In your farewell message to your coworker , thank them for all their hard work and let them know their new company will be lucky to have them. Here are some examples: [2] X Research source “Thank you for all your dedication and hard work. Your presence will be deeply missed. Best of luck in your new role!” “Wishing you all the best on your next adventure! We'll miss your infectious enthusiasm around the office.” “It's been a pleasure working with you. Your talent and kindness have left a lasting impact on all of us. Stay in touch!” “Saying goodbye is never easy, especially to a colleague as wonderful as you. Wishing you joy and fulfillment in your new role.” “Although we're sad to see you go, we're also incredibly proud of your achievements. Best wishes for your new job!” “Wishing you the best of luck with your new job! Your talent and hard work will surely take you far.” “Your professionalism and positive attitude have been a source of inspiration to us all. We’ll miss you!” “It's been a pleasure working with you. You've made a significant impact here, and I know you'll do the same in your new role.” “Working with you has been a privilege. Thank you for your friendship and professionalism. I wish you all the success in your new role.” “I've learned so much from you, and your dedication has always inspired me. Good luck with your new job, and thank you for everything!”

steps.title: Thank a boss for their leadership.
steps.content: Thank a boss for their leadership. When a boss leaves a company, you’re not just losing a coworker—you’re losing a mentor. When writing a farewell for your boss , think of everything they’ve taught you and how they’ve inspired you. Thank them for their dedication and let them know how they’ve impacted you. Here are some examples: [3] X Research source “Thank you for all of your guidance—you’ve been a wonderful mentor. Best of luck with your future!” “Although I will miss having you as my mentor and manager, I am confident that you will continue to lead brilliantly in your new position. I wish you all the best!” “Your unwavering support, mentorship, and belief in my abilities have been instrumental in my professional growth. Thank you for being an incredible leader.” “You’ve been a brilliant leader! Good luck in your next endeavour.” “Farewell to a boss who has believed in my potential and challenged me to go beyond my comfort zone. Thank you for everything, and best of luck in your new endeavors!” “Your leadership style has made a positive impact on the entire team. Thank you for believing in us. Wishing you continued success and happiness!” “Your leadership has made a lasting impact, and I'm grateful for the opportunities you've provided. Wishing you all the best in your future endeavors!” “As our boss, you have fostered a culture of excellence and encouraged personal and professional growth. All the best for your future!” “You've been more than a boss; you've been a source of motivation and a role model. Thank you for believing in me and helping me reach new heights.” “Thank you for believing in me when it was hard to believe in myself. You have been an amazing boss and will be missed!”

steps.title: Wish an employee luck for their career.
steps.content: Wish an employee luck for their career. If you’re a manager or another boss, show appreciation for everything a departing employee has done during their time with your company. Try to list specific contributions they made, and show professionalism by wishing them success in their future. Here are some examples: [4] X Research source “As you move on to new opportunities, we want to thank you for your outstanding contributions. Your professionalism, creativity, and teamwork have been truly inspiring. Wishing you all the success for your future.” “Saying goodbye to a valued member of our team is never easy. Your commitment, passion and expertise have made a lasting impact. Thank you, and best wishes for this new chapter!” “As you move on to new horizons, know that your contributions have made a lasting impact. Best of luck!” “Thank you for your commitment during your tenure. It's been incredible watching your growth and we'll surely miss you here. Best wishes on your next journey.” “Farewell to a true team player. Your ability to collaborate, motivate, and bring out the best in others has been remarkable. Good luck with your future!” “It's with mixed emotions that we bid farewell to an employee who has become an integral part of our team. You will be greatly missed. Best of luck going forward!” “We will always be grateful to you for all of your hard work and dedication. Any company will be very fortunate to have you. Good luck!” “Your professionalism, integrity, and dedication have set a high standard for others to follow. Thank you for being an exceptional employee!” “You will be greatly missed around here. Wishing you all the best in this next phase of your career!” “Farewell to an employee who has consistently demonstrated professionalism and integrity. Your strong work ethic and reliability have been commendable. Thank you for your invaluable contributions, and good luck in all your future endeavors!”

steps.title: Tell your friend how much you’ll miss them.
steps.content: Tell your friend how much you’ll miss them. Whether your friend is leaving your job, moving away , or anything else that calls for a farewell, be sure to tell them how much they mean to you. Share some of your favorite memories, thank them for standing by you, and let them know how much you’ll miss them. Here are some examples: “You have been a true friend through all my hard days. I’ll miss you dearly.” “Thanks for sticking with me through thick and thin. You’re a great friend, and I’ll miss you so much!” “Miss you already! Thanks for being such a wonderful friend—I know you’ll do great things.” “I’m so grateful you took a chance on our friendship. Good luck with everything!” “True friends never say goodbye; it’s just see you later. I’ll miss you!” “You’re more than just a work friend—you’re a true friend. I can’t wait to hear all about your new adventures!” “Know that no matter where you go, I’ll always be here cheering you on. Farewell, my friend.” “Saying goodbye to a friend is like saying goodbye to half of your soul. Take care until we see each other again.” “Though we're parting ways, our friendship will always stay strong. Take care and stay in touch.” “Farewell, partner in crime! May your new chapter be filled with joy and success.”

steps.title: Thank a teacher for being a great mentor.
steps.content: Thank a teacher for being a great mentor. Whether you’re graduating, your teacher is retiring, or anything else, let them know how much you learned from them. Thank them for everything they’ve taught you, both in class and in life. Show them just how much they’ve impacted you. Here are some examples: “Thank you for being a guiding light in my educational journey. The lessons you taught me will stay with me forever. Farewell and all the best!” “Thanks for your wisdom and patience. You’ve made a significant impact on my life. Wishing you the best in everything you do.” “Your guidance has shaped my future, and I’ll be forever grateful. Farewell and best wishes.” “Teachers like you are rare gems. I’ll miss your insights and encouragement. Thank you for everything!” “More than a teacher, you’ve been a mentor and friend. Farewell and see you soon.” “From day one, you’ve inspired me to be my best self. Thank you for all that you’ve done.” “Thank you for being an incredible teacher and mentor. I’ve grown so much because of you. Best wishes for your future!” “Saying goodbye is never easy, especially to a teacher who has shaped my mind and heart so profoundly. See you later!” “Thank you for all the guidance and support you’ve given me. Stay in touch!” “As we say goodbye, I want to thank you for everything you’ve taught me. You’ve impacted my life in more ways than one.”

steps.title: Wish someone luck with a big move.
steps.content: Wish someone luck with a big move. Moving to a new city, state, or even country is exciting and intimidating, so it’s important to show your support! If someone you’re close to is moving, reflect on your shared memories, let them know you’ll miss them, and wish them luck as they start the new chapter of their life. Here are some examples: [5] X Research source “Wishing you all the best in your new home. May it bring you joy and new adventures!” “We may be miles apart, but we’ll always be connected by heart. Best of luck with your new adventure!” “Good luck with your move! Keep in touch and let us know how you’re settling in.” “Moving is a big change, but I know you’ll handle it with grace. All the best!” “Here’s to new beginnings! Wishing you happiness and success in your new location.” “As you move away to start this new chapter in your life, know that you will be deeply missed. I wish you all the success and happiness in your new journey.” “Saying goodbye is never easy, but I am excited for your future adventures. May your new beginning be filled with amazing experiences and new friendships. Bon voyage!” “Although you are moving away, you’ll always have a special place in my heart. Here’s to fresh starts!” “This move is just the beginning of an exciting new adventure. I know you’ll thrive and make the most out of every opportunity. Good luck!” “It’s hard to see you go, but I’m so proud of you for taking this bold step. Your courage and determination inspire me. We’ll always be here cheering you on!”

steps.title: Make a departing friend or coworker laugh with a funny farewell.
steps.content: Make a departing friend or coworker laugh with a funny farewell. Saying goodbye is often bittersweet and emotional, so try a funny message to break up the tension. Poke fun at their work ethic, make a joke about hating your job, or sarcastically tell them you won’t miss them. Here are some examples: [6] X Research source “Leaving us behind, huh? Well, just remember, we'll always have those embarrassing photos from the office parties.” “You're leaving? But who will we blame for all the crazy ideas and failed experiments now?” “Goodbye? More like good riddance….Just kidding—you’ll be missed!” “Now that you’re gone, who can I find to pick up all my slack?” “I hate to see you go, but I really hate the fact that I’ll have to train someone else to take your place.” “Now that you’re leaving, maybe we can finally get some work done around here!” “I’ve been struggling all week to come up with a heartfelt way of saying goodbye. As soon as I think of one, I’ll let you know.” “Well, at least one of us is making it out of here alive. Congratulations!” “How could you leave me at a time like this? You know I’m not mature enough to handle this job on my own!” “I have to admit, I’m sad to see you go. How else will I keep up with all the office gossip?”

steps.title: Speak from the heart when saying goodbye.
steps.content: Speak from the heart when saying goodbye. When saying farewell, it’s important to let the person leaving know how much they mean to you. Make your message specific by talking about all their best qualities and what you’ll miss about them. Show support for their future endeavors, as well. Here are some examples: [7] X Research source “Life’s journey is taking you to new places, but know that I will always be here to cheer you on. Enjoy every moment and stay in touch!” “Although you must follow your own path, you must have the courage to change directions. I’m so excited to see where your journey takes you next. Best of luck.” “It’s been an honor to know you, and I’m so proud of everything you’ve done. I know you will continue to thrive no matter what you do. Good luck.” “You’re an inspiration to us all, and things won’t be the same without you. We’ll miss you dearly!” “Saying goodbye is bittersweet. I’ll miss you so much, but I know you’re off to bigger and better things. Farewell, and best of luck!” “Sometimes, you must say goodbye to face new challenges and achieve new goals. Though I’ll miss you terribly, I’m so excited to see what you accomplish next.” “Saying goodbye is never easy, but I am excited for you and your next chapter. Keep in touch, and don't forget us here.” “It's hard to see you go, but I know you're destined for great things. Thank you for all your support and friendship. Stay in touch.” “Knowing you has been a highlight of my time here. Thank you for being the wonderful person you are, and good luck with all your new adventures.” “Words cannot express how happy I am for you, or how much I’ll miss you. Thank you for being such an incredible person. I’m so excited to see where life takes you next.”

steps.title: Keep things short and sweet if you don’t know what to say.
steps.content: Keep things short and sweet if you don’t know what to say. If you’re saying goodbye to a colleague you’re not close with, don’t stress about trying to come up with a long, sentimental message. Simply thank them for their time and wish them luck for their future. Here are some examples: [8] X Research source “Though we are sad to see you go, we are so proud of you. Good luck!” “Enjoy the next chapter of your career. We’ll miss you!’ “Best of luck in your new position—your replacement here will have big shoes to fill!” “It’s been a pleasure working with you. Best of luck with your future!” “Remember, it’s not goodbye—it’s see you later!” “Thanks for being a great colleague. Wishing you all the best going forward.” “Saying goodbye isn’t easy, but it's a necessary part of the journey. Here’s to new adventures!” “This isn’t an ending—it’s a new beginning! Best of luck!” “It’s been a pleasure to know you! Good luck with everything, and stay in touch!” “You’ve been a wonderful colleague. Keep up the good work!”

steps.title: Share a well-known goodbye quote.
steps.content: Share a well-known goodbye quote. If you’re having trouble thinking of the right words to say, consider borrowing someone else’s. Choose a farewell quote from a famous writer, celebrity, or historical figure to send off a friend or coworker. Here are some examples: [9] X Research source "If you are brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello." — Paulo Coelho “Goodbyes make you think. They make you realize what you’ve had, what you’ve lost, and what you’ve taken for granted.” — Ritu Ghatourey “Saying goodbye doesn’t mean anything. It’s the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it.” — Trey Parker “So long, see you around, but never a final goodbye.” — Fred Flagler “The easiest way to find out how you feel about someone. Say goodbye.” — Phil Knight “We all take different paths in life, but no matter where we go, we take a little of each other everywhere.” — Tim McGraw “Man’s feelings are always purest and most glowing in the hour of meeting and of farewell.” — Jean Paul Richter “Life is made of so many partings welded together.” — Charles Dickens “Being able to say goodbye is a sign of growth.” — Gustavo Cerati “May the road rise up to meet you, may the wind be always with you, may the sunshine warm you always till we meet again.” — The Hobbit

steps.title: Give the person your message a few days before they leave.
steps.content: Give the person your message a few days before they leave. If you’re not sure when you’ll see the person again once they leave, be sure to deliver your message while they’re still there. If there’s going to be a farewell party, this is a great time to give them your message. Otherwise, aim to give it to them a couple days before they’re scheduled to leave. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Choose an appropriate tone for your message.
steps.content: Choose an appropriate tone for your message. Farewells can be positive or negative depending on the situation. Keep this in mind when choosing a tone for your message. If you know someone is happy about leaving, feel free to write a lighthearted and funny message. If it’s not their choice to leave or you’re not sure how they feel, aim to keep your message more professional and supportive. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Be specific.
steps.content: Be specific. Let the person leaving know that you care about them. Try to avoid generic goodbye messages and instead focus on the person and your relationship with them. Write down all the qualities you admire about them, and if you’re close, share some of your favorite memories with them.

steps.title: Show appreciation for them.
steps.content: Show appreciation for them. If they’re your boss, coworker, or employee, thank them for all the hard work and dedication they’ve given the team. Highlight their contributions and share examples of how they’ve made work more enjoyable. If they’re your friend, thank them for their support and kindness, and let them know how much you admire them. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Wish them well for the future.
steps.content: Wish them well for the future. Saying farewell can be bittersweet, so it’s important to keep your overall message positive. Highlight the good about the situation and express excitement for the person’s future. Let them know you’ll be there to support them.
